qas.question: Who was the French Minister of Marine in 1701?
Which French officer led the 1701 expedition?

context: On the shores of the strait, in 1701, the French officer <a4_0>Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac<a4_0/>, along with fifty-one French people and French Canadians, founded a settlement called Fort Pontchartrain du Détroit, naming it after <a3_0>Louis Phélypeaux, comte de Pontchartrain<a3_0/>, Minister of Marine under Louis XIV. France offered free land to colonists to attract families to Detroit; when it reached a total population of <a2_0>800<a2_0/> in 1765, it was the largest city between Montreal and New Orleans, both also French settlements. By 1773, the population of Detroit was <a0_0>1,400<a0_0/>. By 1778, its population was up to <a1_0>2,144<a1_0/> and it was the third-largest city in the Province of Quebec.
